alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:39PM EDT until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Richland and Lexington Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. At 124.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility with some access roads flooded. Extensive farmland flooding occurs in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:23 PM EDT Friday the stage was 114.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 122.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 1000 AM EDT.
